title: Odesa Cathedral Missile Attack Leaves Ukrainians Bereft
description: Odesa, a port city long beloved by travelers, had been largely spared the worst of the war, but that began changing this week.

title: Putin Plans China Visit as a Russian Leader Joins a North Korea Celebration
description: The visits reflect Moscow’s ongoing efforts to strengthen ties with Asian allies, given its isolation from the West.

title: Judge Vacates Bowe Bergdahl’s Conviction and Dishonorable Discharge
description: The Army colonel overseeing the court-martial trial had applied for a job with the Trump-era Justice Department, raising the appearance of bias.

title: Jill Biden Takes the 2024 Campaign to Paris in Another Overseas Appeal
description: As the United States officially rejoined UNESCO, the first lady delivered what sounded like a campaign message, saying the president had rebuilt bonds that frayed under his predecessor.

title: Israel’s Judicial Overhaul Will Set Off More Showdowns. But When?
description: The government’s vote to limit judicial power set off a night of street chaos. More showdowns are expected, but with Parliament about to recess, it is not clear when or in what form.

title: Trevor Reed, Former U.S. Marine, Injured While Fighting in Ukraine
description: Trevor Reed’s condition was not immediately clear. His decision to return to the region and volunteer to fight for Ukraine created some “exasperation” within the Biden administration, an administration official said.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: China has replaced its foreign minister, the world gets some good economic news, Israel faces a cliffhanger.

title: Russia, seeking a bigger army, moves to raise the top age for military service.
description: If the full Parliament approves the bill, Russian men as old as 30 will be subject to the country’s mandatory year of military service.

title: International Investigation into Mexico’s 43 Missing Students Ends
description: Members of an international panel said that the Mexican armed forces had repeatedly obstructed their efforts to investigate the 2014 disappearance and that they were leaving the country.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Russia Moves to Expand Conscription, Bolstering Its Army
description: A proposed law could add millions of trained soldiers to the recruitment pool for Russia’s war in Ukraine, sparing the Kremlin a general mobilization that could sap support for the conflict.

title: 34 Killed in Algerian Wildfires as Heat Waves Parch Mediterranean Region
description: Algeria’s government said that 10 of the dead were soldiers who were trying to rescue people from the fires, which have raged for days in a forested coastal region.

title: Eight Convicted in 2016 Terrorist Bombings in Brussels
description: The series of attacks was the deadliest such assault in Belgian history. Six of the accused had already been convicted over terrorist attacks in Paris the previous year.

title: Ales Pushkin, Dissident Artist in Belarus, Is Dead in Prison at 57
description: A “holy fool,” in his words, he railed against the repressive Lukashenko government, once with a pile of manure. He died under mysterious circumstances.

title: ‘Attenzione, Pickpocket!’ A TikTok Star Watches Out for Tourists in Italy
description: Monica Poli has spent years patrolling the streets of Venice. Now she’s famous on social media. Well, at least her voice is.

title: U.S. Sends More Weapons to Ukraine Amid Slow Counteroffensive
description: The package, which includes artillery, air defenses and mine-clearing equipment, will help replenish Ukrainian forces advance through dense Russian minefields and other defenses.

title: Somber Mood Settles Over Israel’s Antigovernment Protesters
description: After months of defiance, there was defeat. The right-wing government’s success in passing a law that limits the power of the Supreme Court was a gut punch to the largely liberal and secular opposition.

title: What’s Next for Israel After Judicial Overhaul Vote
description: The opposition fears a slow descent toward authoritarianism, while the government is waiting to see how disruptive and prolonged the response will be from its critics.

title: Israeli Reservists Threaten to Quit Over Judicial Overhaul
description: More than 11,000 Israelis in the military reserve said last week they’d resign if the government’s judicial overhaul went ahead.

title: Ocean Currents in the Atlantic Could Slow by Century’s End, Research Shows
description: The system of ocean currents that regulates the climate for a swath of the planet could collapse sooner than expected, a new analysis found.

title: Amid War, Ukrainian Couples Are Divorcing
description: The conflict in Ukraine has split apart millions of families. The story of Andrii Shapovalov and Tetiana Shapovalova reveals how a couple’s bond can become a casualty.

title: Amid War, Ukrainian Couples Are Divorcing
description: The conflict in Ukraine has split apart millions of families. The story of Andrii Shapovalov and Tetiana Shapovalova reveals how a couple’s bond can become a casualty.

title: Photos Show Wildfires in Europe and North Africa
description: Deadly blazes are raging across portions of southern Europe and North Africa, including the Greek islands and Algeria.

title: Israel Protests in Photos
description: Political turmoil that has been brewing for months reached a crescendo after Parliament passed a law aimed at curbing the power of the judiciary.

title: Israel’s New Judicial Law Could Threaten Attorney General’s Role
description: The law could make it easier for the government to fire the embattled official, Gali Baharav-Miara, who has criticized Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul.

title: Global Economy Shows Signs of Resilience Despite Lingering Threats
description: The International Monetary Fund upgraded its global growth forecast for 2023.

title: Taliban Shut Afghanistan Beauty Salons, Rare Women’s Public Spaces
description: Following through on an order that prompted rare protests in the capital, the Taliban said the services of the women-only businesses violated Shariah law.

title: Qin Gang, China’s Foreign Minister, Is Replaced
description: Qin Gang was removed from office on Tuesday by China’s top leader, Xi Jinping, capping weeks of speculation.

title: Israel’s Political Crisis
description: Now, political leaders will be more powerful and judges less so.

title: Ukraine Trains Marines to Fight Russia in Frontline Conditions
description: A grueling obstacle course, a few miles from the fighting with Russia, is a final step in the initiation for Ukrainian marines.

title: The Wind, the Water, the Islands: Exploring Stockholm’s Archipelago
description: For Swedes, the archipelago, consisting of more than 20,000 islands, is a quintessential summer destination. Travelers can explore it, too, by ferry and rented boat.

title: Biden Takes His Battle for Democracy Case by Case
description: President Biden’s decisions on when to speak out forcefully for democracy can prove tricky.

title: Typhoon Doksuri Heads for Philippines, Taiwan and Southern China
description: Typhoon Doksuri, packing winds equivalent to those of a Category 4 hurricane, is expected to hit China later this week. It also threatens Taiwan.

title: Typhoon Doksuri Heads for Philippines, Taiwan and Southern China
description: Typhoon Doksuri, packing winds equivalent to those of a Category 4 hurricane, is expected to hit China later this week. It also threatens Taiwan.

title: How Israel’s Supreme Court Might React to the Challenge to Its Power
description: The court could strike down the law passed on Monday that seeks to curb its power. Or it might narrowly interpret it. Or it might simply put off any decision.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Here’s what you need to know.

title: July Heat Waves ‘Virtually Impossible’ Without Climate Change, Study Finds
description: The latest study from World Weather Attribution scientists predicts that extreme heat waves will return more frequently.

title: July Heat Waves Affected by Climate Change, Attribution Study Finds
description: The latest study from World Weather Attribution scientists predicts that extreme heat waves will return more frequently.
